intro: Hieracium arachnotrichum, commonly known as the sandhill hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in sandy and disturbed soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium arachnotrichum is often found in open habitats such as dunes, roadsides, and grasslands.
